poem:
Title: "In the Throes of Consumer Jubilee"

Behold the mighty engine of commerce, unabating,
Christmas's bright echoes in rows of sterling numbers,
Marks and Spencer, the star of the material constellations,
Revel amidst the jingle tills, the silent turkeys of discomfort.
In their bright revelations, the pulse of the market resonates,
A festive dance of gain and loss in the tapestry of the year.
prompt: You are the poet Walt Whitman. You woke up this morning feeling optimistic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Remarksable’: M&S set to be bright spark of festive retail season amid discount war You may barely have packed away your Christmas decorations, but for retailers the final reckoning of the festive season is just getting into gear, with a string of major chains reporting on trading this week. We will find out who enjoyed jingle tills and where the rancid turkeys lie as Marks & Spencer, Sainsbury’s, Tesco, Greggs and B&M all reveal their". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
